alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 9:47AM EDT until June 26 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Morris County in northern New Jersey... Southwestern Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey... Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... Southeastern Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1030 AM EDT. * At 947 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Belvidere, or 12 miles northeast of Easton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Hopatcong, East Stroudsburg, Hackettstown, Washington, Blairstown, Bangor, Mount Arlington, Stanhope, Pen Argyl, Netcong, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Alpha, Hope, East Bangor, Andover, Brass Castle, Werry Lake and Greendell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 3 and 5. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 312 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 31. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
